FuncDef:
The radius-attribute command configures the mode of encapsulating user IP addresses.
undo radius-attribute command restores the default configuration.
By default, a user address is encapsulated in version 1 mode. Only an effective address for which a routing entry has been generated can be encapsulated into the attributes of the RADIUS server. Without an effective address, the attributes will not be delivered by the RADIUS server.
CLIs: radius-attribute { framed-ip-address | delegated-ipv6-prefix } encapsulation-method { version1 | version2 }
undo radius-attribute { framed-ip-address | delegated-ipv6-prefix } encapsulation-method version2

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the attributes of a user's IPv4 address.
-

Indicates the mode of encapsulating the attributes of IP addresses.
-

Indicates that a user address is encapsulated in version 1 mode by default, which means only an effective address can be encapsulated into the attributes of the RADIUS server.
-

Indicates that encapsulating attributes in version 2 mode requires an effective address for encapsulation. Without an effective address, use the ineffective address delivered by a RADIUS server for encapsulation. Without either address, the attributes will not be delivered by the RADIUS server.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The radius-attribute command configures an encapsulation mode for user IP addresses.
Encapsulating attributes in version 2 mode requires an effective address for encapsulation. Without an effective address, use the ineffective address delivered by a RADIUS server for encapsulation.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
